messages.content: {{greeting}} Claude! Please respond with a friendly greeting and tell me you're working correctly.

greeting.description: A greeting to send to Claude

messages.content: Create a Jira issue in the project '{{projectKey}}' with summary '{{summary}}' and description '{{description}}'. Use issue type '{{issueType}}' if specified, otherwise use 'Task'.

issueType.description: Type of issue (Task, Bug, Story, etc.)

projectKey.description: Project key for the Jira project

messages.content: Clone the GitHub repository '{{repository}}' to the current working directory using git tools. Make sure to clone it into the current working directory where this process is running, not into any parent directories. If there's already a local copy in the current directory, update it to the latest version by running 'git pull' inside the repository folder. Use https methods that will work with a .git-credentials file.

repository.description: Repository URL or name in format 'owner/repo'. Example: 'bitovi/bitovi-jira-redirect'.

messages.content: Analyze the GitHub repository '{{repository}}' and provide insights about its structure, recent activity, and potential improvements.
You are an expert code reviewer. Analyze the provided code and give constructive feedback.
Please review the code in {{filePath}} and provide feedback on code quality, potential issues, and suggested improvements.

filePath.description: Path to the file to review

messages.content: Generate a project status report for {{projectKey}}. Include information from both Jira issues and GitHub repository activity. Focus on progress over the last {{timeframe}} days.

projectKey.description: Jira project key or GitHub repository

timeframe.description: Number of days to look back

messages.content: Check the git status of the current repository and commit any staged changes with the message '{{commitMessage}}'. If no changes are staged, stage all modified files first. Use the built-in git tools available in the workspace.
